title: Hitman Pro 3.7.9 - Build 245 + Patch
description:
Hitman Pro 3.7.9 Build 242 x86 and x64 + working patch + Fix


Keeping the malware off your system and removing rogue, fak or misleading software, dangerous keyloggers, tracking cookies and other such threats is not an easy task. Luckily, there are many specicialized tools with this goal, such as Hitman Pro. It is a powerful aplication that can detecht and remove most viruses that could come in contact with your computer.


Cloud-assisted virus remover

Right off the bat you can notice a great thing about this utility, namely the fact that it uses a cloud engine when scanning, therefore several anti-malware engines are at work to help you find and obliterate any trace of dangerous and malicious code.


Find and remove threats easily

Another neat feature of Hitman Pro is the ability to run without installation, so it can be used from a portable storage device. In case you wish to keep it op your system, select the option to create a copy of the utility on your desktop, so you can regularly scan your computer.

The default scan takes a few minutes to complete and you can track the real-time progress and view on the spot any dangerous items found in your system. Viruses or other types of computer infections can be either deleted, quarantined, ignored (not recommended) or reported as safe. A small description of each threat is displayed below the files in the list, as well as the level of risk it presents.


Evaluation and conclusion

During my (Rubberboy37) test, Gitman Pro managed to find a lot of tracking cookies and a couple of suspicious executable files in the Temporary Internet Files Folder, which were swifly removed.

All in all, this application looks and works very well. Even if it may not be suited as a first line of defense, Hitman Pro can surely prove a great addition that can work alongside a fully-fledged Anti-Virus solution.


Changes in 3.7.9 Build 242:

IMPROVED: Remnant Scan
UPDATED: Polish language
FIXED: Rare Illegal Instruction Exception caused by bug in MSVCR120 on 64-bit system
SEE HERE: https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/Feedback/Details/981479
